repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
1. comletion prefix value sub index not correct. which cause
       input `wp.` completion in there after do and type w the completion
       window will be delete.
 2. wrong complete-word generate this will include symbol like `->` ,
       it will make compl_match_array build failed. because the leader
       is character it can not find in this complete-word(cp_str).

Solution:
1. use max value of server_bounary, word_boundary
2. use vimregex keyword remove unncessary symbols.


before

![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed3d7522-8b0b-4d8c-a9a1-9ea153f2b8d9)

After

![after](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cf8565c1-ea41-4676-95ec-be6febbab1fc)

comment_data.body: Not sure about this trim. If there's leading whitespace I feel like either the label is incorrect or the space is intentional.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -265,7 +270,7 @@ function M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
       end
       local completion_item = {
         word = word,
-        abbr = item.label,
+        abbr = vim.trim(item.label),

comment_data.body:
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/7ba6768df8181bc270763333969d4a1d6cc2e160/mlir/lib/Tools/mlir-pdll-lsp-server/PDLLServer.cpp#L709

there is no trim so we can assume that the server did this on purpose? currently I can accept only one space. If there are multiple spaces in the prefix, it will increase the width of the pum.  spaces have meaning in the abbr? The abbr is only displayed in the pum and does not actually have any effect.

comment_data.body:
clangd prefixes some items with a •, so I assume the space is to keep all items aligned:

```
 a                                                                Variable   std::unique_ptr<A>
 A                                                                Struct
•ADJ_ESTERROR                                                     Text
•ADJ_FREQUENCY                                                    Text
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -265,7 +270,7 @@ function M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
       end
       local completion_item = {
         word = word,
-        abbr = item.label,
+        abbr = vim.trim(item.label),

@@ -154,8 +154,13 @@ local function get_completion_word(item)
       return item.label
     end
   elseif item.textEdit then
-    local word = item.textEdit.newText
-    return word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    local word = item.textEdit.newText:gsub('%s+$', '')
+    if word:match('^%W') then
+      local matched_word = vim.fn.matchstr(word, '\\k\\+')
+      return matched_word ~= '' and matched_word or word
+    else
+      return word
+    end

comment_regular_data.body:
seems like vscode also add new completion list when length > 0 
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/789c320a1c67bb0547cdef2b8b82634bf93929a3/extensions/npm/src/features/jsonContributions.ts#L142

> seems like vscode also add new completion list when length > 0 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/789c320a1c67bb0547cdef2b8b82634bf93929a3/extensions/npm/src/features/jsonContributions.ts#L142

`items.length > 0 || isIncomplete` - the `|| isIncomplete` would match my point about it being able to narrow/finish the completion if there are no more candidates, no?
I still don't understand why you want to get rid of this behavior.

If I understand the problem description of the PR right, only the `word` change is required, and the trim + empty matches change could be reverted?
yes you are right . i check it again because the wrong prefix value in _convert_results it sub prefix to `.w` then client_matchs is empty in second request.
is the commit message (and subject line) up to date?

It would be really helpful to mention (in PR description and commit message), the user-facing effect. The current description is just details about the implementation. What is the *user-facing* symptom that is being fixed? Like this:

```
before: input => result

    foo => bar

after:

    foo2 => bar2

```

Please *always* do this in the future. This is far more helpful than random details about the implementation. Especially when the tests are 40 lines long, it's hard to see what's going on.
in github page is not latest..i have update commit message before (its more clear). but not this format what you suggest.. i will update again.
Oh sorry, I should have looked at your screenshots. I think I understand now, but I'll wait for your update. Thank you!

It looks like this breaks completion for servers like vscode-html-ls where so far you could complete ending tags. E.g. for `<li>foo<|` you got something like:

```
dap> result
table: 0x7466baa2cf28
  isIncomplete: false
  items: table: 0x7466baa2cfa8
    1: table: 0x7466baa2cff0
      filterText: /li
      insertTextFormat: 1
      kind: 10
      label: /li
      textEdit: table: 0x7466baa2d0d8
        newText: /li>
        range: table: 0x7466baa2d120
          end: table: 0x7466baa2d1e8
          start: table: 0x7466baa2d168
dap> candidates
table: 0x7466ba8d8398
  1: table: 0x7466ba8d8c68
    abbr: /li
    dup: 1
    empty: 1
    hl_group: 
    icase: 1
    info: 
    kind: Property
    menu: 
    user_data: table: 0x7466ba8d90c0
    word: /li>
```

With this change the `word` is just `li`:

```
dap> candidates
table: 0x78a2de10e290
  1: table: 0x78a2ddf663e0
    abbr: /li
    dup: 1
    empty: 1
    hl_group: 
    icase: 1
    info: 
    kind: Property
    menu: 
    user_data: table: 0x78a2de562570
    word: li
```

I'm afraid we'll have to find another solution to this.

Nice. So filter_text is defined in the same way as in [lsp](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/)?

Seems like something that should be sent to https://github.com/vim/vim ?

```typescript
	/**
	 * A string that should be used when filtering a set of
	 * completion items. When omitted the label is used as the
	 * filter text for this item.
	 */
	filterText?: string;
```
here https://github.com/vim/vim/pull/15716 . word may have symbols we use word as `cp_str` for leader match this will cause no any matches found.

word is usually `textEdit.newText` , finally fallback to label.  check our `get_completion_word`. But newText will contain some necessary symbols such as pointer symbols `->` or html tag symbols `/li>`. lsp supports us to trigger completion with a dot after a pointer variable. This means that word as cp_str will contain symbols `->` neither `strncmp` nor `fuzzy_match_str` will get results. `filterText` is a clean existence. When isInComplete is false, filterText as cp_str is a more effective match leader than newText.  most detials can check the test cases which in linked vim PR .  any thought @mfussenegger  @justinmk ?
since not a lua part problem closed.
